text: Number 5250, Bostic against the United States.
Mr. Chief Justice and may it please the Court.
Was this while he was a fugitive?
Ms. Rosenberg, perhaps you should lower the podium where you can get closer to the microphone.
We have some very tall men here today.
This quotation on page 12 to 13 in our brief is in volume 22 of the record which got lost at that time.
Then I was mistaken when I said it was opening statement, it was the argument of the jury.

It was the argument of the jury, it was the opening argument at the close of the case, but that appeared earlier the trial too and I call your attention to voir dire of the jury when they’re being picked and that took a lot of time because of the murder, there were 20 challenges, but I think its four times as they were groups called up.
Yes, but didn’t it help you quite a bit to have him cut loose from this, at least very much premeditated murder, motivated murder?
Thank you, Mr. Binkley, thank you Ms. Rosenberg.
